frameDefinitions: The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action .
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.

The Means action by which a deprofiled agent (the Protagonist) has attempted to achieve a Goal, is finished and the actual outcome of the Means action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Protagonist's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
In this frame an Action is evaluated with respect to how fairly, justly or equitably the Action affects the Affected_party.
A particular piece of Information is evaluated for its accuracy.
An Agent has done or omitted to do an Act or is responsible for the obtaining of a State_of_affairs, which a Judge deems to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline.
frameExamples: The underwater sequences <t>warrant</t> the price of the admission alone.
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
Smithers was being very <t>fair</t> about the distribution of supplies.
Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> information?
Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> his decision.
listRoleDefinitions: An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for taking another <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that is taken to be justifiable given the <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen>.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
When the <fen>Events</fen> concerning the <fen>Participant</fen> occured.
The action that the agent undertakes to achieve the <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the agent attempts to achieve by performing the <fen>Means</fen> action.
An entity directed by the agent as part of the <fen>Means</fen> action in order to accomplish the <fen>Goal</fen>.
A participant function of an <fen>Instrument</fen> or <fen>Means</fen> in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails
The place where <fen>Means</fen> action succeeds or fails.
The <fen>Actor</fen> is the individual who performs the <fen>Action</fen> and can thus be characterized with repsect to how that <fen>Action</fen> affects the <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is judged based on how just and appopriate it is to the <fen>Affected_party</fen> in a particular situation.
The <fen>Grounds</fen> is the event or state that requires some decision or action in response to it for which the <fen>Actor</fen> is judged.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen>'s treatment is what determines the evaluation of the <fen>Actor</fen>'s <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
The event which communicates the <fen>Information</fen>.
The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.
The person or organization that  is held responsible for a prior <fen>Act</fen> or for a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
An action  for which the <fen>Agent</fen> is held responsible, frequently one that the <fen>Agent</fen> has taken themself.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> that the Agent is held responsible for.
The <fen>Time</fen> of the justifying event.
listRoleExamples: <fex>A heavy contact to the opponent 's face</fex> may not merit just a verbal warning
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.
<fex>His daring, almost reckless, move</fex> succeeded and he lived to fight another day.

This move succeeded <fex>in securing trade concessions and the release of imprisoned
American sailors</fex>.
All of my usual source books seemed incomplete, but <fex>your website</fex> did the trick!
The machine was successful <fex>as a reconnaissance vehicle</fex>.
But it did the trick <fex>at the time</fex>.
A similar strategy, perhaps even bloodier, did the trick <fex>in El Salvador</fex>.
<fex>Smithers</fex> defended his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment
Kim failed  to fully justify <fex>his decision</fex>.
The lawyers tried  to justify <fex>enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Office of Management and Budget
the Affordable Clean Energy Rule Regulatory Impact Analysis
